title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.7-9 | 5-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्य ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनतस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओमिष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शून्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्रीवास अधी गौरभक्त वृन्दा

Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare, Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya, Narayanam Namaskritya, Naram Chayiva Narottamam, Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet.
In this session we will be discussing from the three verses of this twelfth chapter of first canto of Bhagavatam, verses seven, eight and nine.
To begin with verse number seven, Matur Garbha Gato Veeraha Satadhaa Bhrugunandana Dadarsha Purusham Kanchit Dasyamano Astratejasaa.
The translation of this verse is as follows.
O son of Bhrugu, Suthu Goswami is addressing the sage Naimisharanya headed by Shaunaka Rishi.
He is addressed as Bhrugunandana, son of Bhrugu.

When the child Pariksit, the great fighter, was in the womb of his mother Uttara and was suffering from the burning heat of the Brahmastra thrown by Ashwathama, he could observe the Supreme Lord coming to him.
Something extraordinary happened at the time when Pariksit was in his mother's womb and Ashwathama attempted to kill this child by releasing a Brahmastra targeted at this child only.
Unlike the modern weapons, the mantras which are used as weapons, mantra, astra.
They can be directed towards a very specific target and they will go searching for the target wherever the target may be and destroy the target, attack the target.
So that is explained by Prabhupada in the purport.
Death generally involves remaining in trance for seven months.
A living being according to his own action is allowed to enter into the womb of a mother.
By the vehicle of a father's Samina, semen.
And thus he develops his desired body.
This is the law of birth in specific bodies according to one's past actions.
When he is awake from trance, he feels the inconvenience of being confined within the womb.
After seven months, a child in the womb of a mother.
When the child enters the womb as a soul.
Transfer from one body to the next body.
Then he enters a human mother's womb.
And then seven months the child is lying.
But he awakens after the seventh month.
And seventh month when he awakens he is like in a mother's womb.
Feels the inconvenience of being confined.
Called the womb of the mother.
And also experiences the surroundings are full of all kinds of secretions in the mother's womb.
All kinds of urine, pus, mucus, blood, stool.
And thus he wants to come out of the mother's womb.
And sometimes fortunately such a soul.
Prays to the Lord for such liberation.
Maharaj Pariksit while in the womb of his mother.
And he was feeling the burning heat.
But Maharaj Pariksit is no ordinary soul.
Because he was a devotee of the Lord.
The Lord at once appeared himself within the womb.
And the child could see that someone else had come to save him.
Pariksit is bold enough to face the Brahmastra.
Krishna personally entered the womb of his mother.
Krishna has a personal interest in that devotee.
And Pariksit could see someone else has come into the womb.
The child Pariksit endured the unbearable temperature.
Due to his being a great fighter by nature.
And for this reason the word Viraha has been used.
Pariksit has been described as Matur Garbhagato Viraha.
Viraha is a very powerful fighter.
Able to tolerate the extraordinary heat of the Brahmastra.
Entering the womb of his mother.
What kind of form of the Lord.
The meaning of this eighth verse.
Describing the form of the Lord.
That Pariksit saw in his mother's womb.
He had a very very beautiful.
And he wore a dress of lightning yellow.
And a helmet of blazing gold.
Thus he was seen by the child.
And the Lord was seen by the child.
The dress is like lightning yellow.
The Lord was enriched with four hands.
And eyes blood red with fury.
His club constantly encircled him like a shooting star.
He was just encircling like a shooting star.
Srila Prabhupada says in the purport.
It is said in the Brahma Samhita.
Enters into the hallow of the universe.
And distributes himself as Paramatma of the Supersoul.
Not only within the heart of every living being.
But also within every atom of the material elements.
This is the beginning of creation.
He lies on the Karna ocean.
They come in seed like form.
Maha Vishnu expands as Garbhodakshayi Vishnu.
First of all the material dormant material energy.
And then that material energy develops.
Into each seed like form of the universe.
Lord expands and enters the second Vishnu.
The whole material world is created.
Thus the lord is all pervading by his inconceivable energy.
He has entered into the heart of every living being.
every living being is entered into the inside every material atom who can
conceive this it's inconceivable achintya and he also entered the womb of
mother Uttara to save his beloved devotee Maharaj Parikshit if he can
enter into every material atom he enters into every universe he enters
into the heart of every living being why can't he enter the womb of mother
Uttara for the sake of his devotee to save his devotee from the attack of the
Brahma's throne so in the Bhagavad Gita again Srila Prabhupada is quoting the
Bhagavad Gita 9.31 9th chapter 31st verse the Lord
assured everyone that his devotees are never to be vanquished
kaunteya pratijaanihi na me bhakta-pranasyati my devotee mad-bhakta na
pranasyati is never vanquished so no one can kill a devotee of the Lord
because he is protected by the Lord and no one can save a person whom the
Lord desires to kill maare Krishna rakshake rakshake Krishna maare ke if
Krishna wants to protect a devotee nobody can kill that devotee and if
Krishna wants to kill some Asura or demon or some miscreant nobody can
protect that miscreant and that's what happened to Ravana he was a devotee of
Shiva and he is praying to Shiva kindly protect me
when Rama came to attack Ravana and she was Rama the Supreme Personality of
God wants to kill you who can protect you nobody can save and if Krishna wants
to protect Parikshit Maharaj no brahmastra no person no weapon nothing

The Pariksit Maharaj devotee. The lord is all powerful and therefore he can both save and kill as he likes. He became visible to his devotee Maharaj Pariksit, even in that awkward position in the womb of his mother, in a shape just suitable for his vision.

Lord gave him darshan. And Srila Prabhupada explains, the lord can become bigger than thousands of universes. Mahavishnu. He is lying on the causal ocean and within his body there are millions of universes.
And he can become smaller than an atom at the same time and enter into the...
Every material atom. Merciful as he is, he becomes just suitable to the vision of the limited living being.
He is unlimited. He is not limited by any measurement of our calculation. But he can become bigger than we can think of and he can become smaller than what we can conceive.
But in all circumstances he is the same all powerful supreme lord. His position, his power does not change.
Unlimited power is always with him.
So, the lord mercifully gave darshan to Pariksit and also saved him. That's his mercy upon his pure devotee.
I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
